alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 12:03PM MST until December 02 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM MST FOR YUMA AND KIT CARSON COUNTIES... At 1201 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a cold front extending from 4 miles northwest of Wray to 22 miles west of Bonny Reservoir to 9 miles southeast of Cope to 9 miles south of Thurman, moving southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. Wind gusts in excess of 65 mph have been measured with this cold front. Several pictures have also confirmed a large area of dust occurring. SOURCE...Doppler radar, satellite observations and public reports. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 269. This dust channel will be near... Wray around 1205 PM MST. Flagler around 1215 PM MST. Stratton and Seibert around 1220 PM MST. Bonny Reservoir, Bethune and Vona around 1225 PM MST. Burlington around 1230 PM MST. Other locations impacted by this dust channel include Joes, Hale, Abarr, Beecher Island, Kirk, Heartstrong and Alvin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
